intro: Evolvulus lithospermoides var. martii, commonly known as the rock morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often trailing or ascending. The species is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
